_comment: The following JSON file is a catalog of RAM addresses used in the game Final Fantasy for the NES. It contains two other top level elements: 'ram_addresses' and 'lookups'. The 'ram_addresses' element contains a list of RAM addresses used in the game, along with their names, descriptions, types, and possible values. The 'lookups' element contains a list of lookup tables that can be referenced by the RAM addresses to indicate their values. This is to reduce data duplication. If the values element of a ram address does not contain a `lookup` key to reference a specific lookup, it will either contain it's list of possible values directly, or a single description attribute explaining the meaning of the value.

0x006100.name: Character 1 Class
0x006100.description: This is the class of Character 1. It defines which weapons, armor and spells the character can use. It may also define special abilities, such as the Thief's special ability to run from battle more easily than other characters.

0x006102.name: Character 1 Name, 1st Letter
0x006102.description: This is the first letter of Character 1's name. It is used to display the character's name in the game. Note that the values are not ASCII or any other standard encoding, but rather a custom encoding used by the game.

0x006103.name: Character 1 Name, 2nd Letter
0x006103.description: This is the second letter of Character 1's name. It is used to display the character's name in the game. Note that the values are not ASCII or any other standard encoding, but rather a custom encoding used by the game.

0x006104.name: Character 1 Name, 3rd Letter
0x006104.description: This is the third letter of Character 1's name. It is used to display the character's name in the game. Note that the values are not ASCII or any other standard encoding, but rather a custom encoding used by the game.

0x006105.name: Character 1 Name, 4th Letter
0x006105.description: This is the fourth letter of Character 1's name. It is used to display the character's name in the game. Note that the values are not ASCII or any other standard encoding, but rather a custom encoding used by the game.

0x00610A.name: Character 1 HP, Low Byte
0x00610A.description: This is the low byte of Character 1's current HP (Hit Points). HP is a measure of a character's health. When a character's HP reaches 0, they are knocked out and can no longer participate in battle until they are revived.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the low byte of HP. The decimal total of HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

0x00610B.name: Character 1 HP, High Byte
0x00610B.description: This is the high byte of Character 1's current HP (Hit Points). HP is a measure of a character's health. When a character's HP reaches 0, they are knocked out and can no longer participate in battle until they are revived.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the high byte of HP. The decimal total of HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

0x00610C.name: Character 1 Maximum HP, Low Byte
0x00610C.description: This is the low byte of Character 1's maximum HP (Hit Points). Maximum HP is the highest amount of HP a character can have. It can normally be increased only by leveling up. The decimal total of Maximum HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the low byte of Maximum HP. The decimal total of Maximum HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

0x00610D.name: Character 1 Maximum HP, High Byte
0x00610D.description: This is the high byte of Character 1's maximum HP (Hit Points). Maximum HP is the highest amount of HP a character can have. It can normally be increased only by leveling up. The decimal total of Maximum HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the high byte of Maximum HP. The decimal total of Maximum HP is calculated as (High Byte * 256) + Low Byte.

0x006110.name: Character 1 Strength
0x006110.description: This is Character 1's Strength (`STR.`) stat. Strength ostensibly affects the characters Damage stat (Damage should be the sum of Strength and Weapon Power), but during testing, although increasing Strength did increase the `STR` (Strength) value in the status screen, it did not increase the `DAMAGE` stat for the character even after leaving the status menu and returning, and did not seem to increase the damage dealt by the character in battle.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Strength stat.

0x006111.name: Character 1 Agility
0x006111.description: This is Character 1's Agility (`AGL.`) stat. Agility ostensibly affects both the characters Evade and Hit % stats, but during testing, although increasing Agility did increase the `AGL` (Agility) value in the status screen, it did not increase the `EVADE %` or `HIT %` stats for the character even after leaving the status menu and returning.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Agility stat.

0x006112.name: Character 1 Intelligence
0x006112.description: This is Character 1's Intelligence (`INT.`) stat. It is a known non-functional stat that has no effect other than being displayed in the status screen.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Intelligence stat.

0x006113.name: Character 1 Vitality
0x006113.description: This is Character 1's Vitality (`VIT.`) stat. Some documentation suggests that Vitality affects the characters defense and/or the amount of HP they gain with each level, but this is unverified.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Vitality stat.

0x006114.name: Character 1 Luck
0x006114.description: This is Character 1's Luck (`LUCK`) stat. Luck affects the characters chance to successfully run from battle. During testing, increasing luck did appear to work as intended to flee battle.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Luck stat.

0x006120.name: Character 1 Damage
0x006120.description: This is Character 1's Damage (`DAMAGE`) stat. It is calculated as the sum of the character's Strength and their equipped Weapon's Power. However, during testing, increasing Strength did not increase the `DAMAGE` stat for the character even after leaving the status menu and returning. Increasing Damage did however increase the damage dealt by the character in battle, as expected.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Damage stat.

0x006121.name: Character 1 Hit %
0x006121.description: This is Character 1's Hit % (`HIT %`) stat. It is calculated as the sum of the character's Agility and their equipped Weapon's Accuracy. However, during testing, increasing Agility did not increase the `HIT %` stat for the character even after leaving the status menu and returning.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Hit % stat.

0x006122.name: Character 1 Absorb
0x006122.description: This is Character 1's Absorb (`ABSORB`) stat. It is calculated as the simple sum of the characters equipped armors. Absorb reduces the damage taken from physical attacks.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Absorb stat.

0x006123.name: Character 1 Evade %
0x006123.description: This is Character 1's Evade (`EVADE %`) stat. It is calculated as the sum of the character's Agility less the penalties associated with the `weight` of their equipped armors. The Evade stat reduces the chance that an enemy will successfully hit the character with a physical attack.

values.description: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF representing the Evade stat.

0x006123.name: Character 2 Class
0x006123.description: This is the class of Character 2. It defines which weapons, armor and spells the character can use. It may also define special abilities, such as the Thief's special ability to run from battle more easily than other characters.
